case_vignette: A 55-year-old female patient comes to your office complaining of white spots on her tongue. She reports that she first noticed them about one week ago. She denies pain or difficulty swallowing. Her past medical history is significant for asthma, hepatitis C, and heroin abuse. She had previously been homeless and only recently went to the doctor one month ago for the first time in over five years. At that time, her primary care physician prescribed sofosbuvir, an albuterol inhaler, and daily inhaled fluticasone, which she has been using as directed. She is sexually active with one male partner. Her last HIV test was negative, and she does not have a history of sexually transmitted diseases. She denies current alcohol or intravenous drug use. She smokes a pack a day of cigarettes and reports she has been smoking since she was 16. On physical examination, you note lesions on her oral mucosa that are easily scraped off, as shown in Figure A.
question: Which  is the best treatment for this patient’s most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Infectious Diseases. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've got white spots on my tongue that I noticed about a week ago.
Have you noticed any other symptoms such as fever, sore throat, or difficulty swallowing?
No, I haven't had any pain or difficulty swallowing.
Have you had any recent travel history or contact with someone who has recently traveled to a tropical region?
No, I haven't traveled recently or been in contact with anyone who has traveled to a tropical region.
Have you had any recent changes in your diet or eating habits?
No, I haven't had any changes in my diet or eating habits.
Have you had any recent changes in your oral hygiene routine?
No, I haven't had any changes in my oral hygiene routine.
Have you had any recent changes in your stress level or sleep patterns?
No, I haven't noticed any changes in my stress level or how I've been sleeping.
Have you had any recent changes in your weight or appetite?
No, my weight and appetite have been the same.
Have you had any recent changes in your medication regimen?
Yes, a month ago I started taking sofosbuvir, using an albuterol inhaler, and daily inhaled fluticasone as my doctor prescribed.
Final Diagnosis: Oral Thrush
